intro: Ketmia mutabilis, commonly known as the variable ketmia, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments and has lance-shaped leaves with a slightly hairy surface. Its flowers, which range in color from white to yellow, bloom in clusters and attract various pollinators. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
